column4: i can only upgrade one distro at a time? i can't go from 9x to 11x?
i remember why i'm using freebsd for a filesever now...
and openbsd for a router
Are you trying to upgrade remotely?
9.10 is also eol, amd 10.04 is LTS
yes
Is it own box or vps (mean virtual system)?
and it's turning into upgarding 5 times to finally get to the top of the ladder...
One moment
and you have installed update-manager-core?
yes.
So what is wrong with running do-release-upgrade in screen session?
a do-release-upgrade => an upgrade from jaunty to lucid is not supported with this tool
You are 9.04, and want to upgrade to where?
haha, whatever the channel supports...
try to edit /etc/update-manager/release-upgrades and change normal to lts, and see if this helps.
Now do-release-upgrade let you upgrade to 9.10, right?
no new release found
do-release-upgrade --proposed ???
a do-release-upgrade => an upgrade from jaunty to lucid is not supported with this tool
